title.narrative: 1.1 CHILD RIGHTS MONITORING

description.narrative: 1.1 Child rights decision-making bodies and independent institutions have required knowledge and skills to design, budget, monitor and implement evidence-based age, gender and disability-sensitive policies and programmes., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid), Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, the most vulnerable children and youth benefit from policy coherence, evidence-based and inclusive decision-making and financing for social development in line with the national SDGs and international standards.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1 Child rights decision-making bodies and independent institutions have required knowledge and skills to design, budget, monitorand implement evidence-based age, gender and disability-sensitive policies and programmes.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s advocacy resulted in the recognition of the importance of independent child rights monitoring and;creating;a;specialised;Ombudsperson;post.;Joint;work;with;partners;led to the ratification of the;Convention on the Rights of the Persons with Disabilities;(CRPD),;the;design of a;national;action plan and a;joint;programme.The;UNICEF-led;programme;is;targeting;inclusive services’ modelling;and investing in;civil society;capacity;to;demonstrate;the;shift from a medical to human rights;approach.;;The;Multi-Cluster Indicator Survey;conducted with UNICEF’s support;will inform;SDG monitoring for more than 30;disaggregated;indicators;related to women and children.;;;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022
